availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Morrow (Knoxville, TN, asst adjt gen'l to Gen JG Foster)

body.p: Knoxville, Tennessee, soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Samuel Morrow and Melinda Morrow. Resident of Knoxville in 1850. Resident of Knoxville in 1860. Served under General John Gray Foster as major, brevet colonel, and assistant adjutant general from September 14, 1863, to November 30, 1866.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Knox County, Knoxville, p. 105A.

Official Army Register for 1867, United States Adjutant General's Office, (Washington, D.C.: August 1, 1867), p. 141.
Find A Grave, “Robert Morrow (1846-1873)," Memorial # 5869443, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5869443/robert-morrow (accessed December 23, 2020).
